title: Ex-President Ranil seen attending event for first time after released on bail
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, who was released on bail recently following his arrest over the alleged misuse of public property, has been seen for the first time attending an event after he was discharged from hospital.

title: Second Reading of National Building Research Institute Bill in Parliament next week
byline: Parliament is scheduled to meet for four days next week.

title: Heavy rain wreaks havoc in India’s Dehradun; 15 killed in the state, 16 missing
byline: Cloudbursts and heavy rains overnight left a trail of destruction in Uttarakhand’s capital Dehradun and several other parts of the state on Tuesday as swollen rivers washed away buildings, roads and bridges, leaving 15 people dead, 16 missing, and 900 stranded in different locations in the hill state.

title: Second phase of ‘Clean Sri Lanka’ Urban Forest Project launched in Thotalaga
byline: The second phase of the Urban Forest Project under the ‘Clean Sri Lanka’ initiative, was launched today (17) Thotalaga.

title: Monk and two others arrested with heroin in Alawwa
byline: A monk and two other individuals have been arrested for possession of heroin in Alawwa by the Matale Division Crimes Investigation Unit.

title: YouTube announces expanded suite of tools for creators in latest AI push
byline: YouTube is introducing a slew of AI-powered tools aimed at lightening creators’ workloads.

title: Malwathu & Asgiri Chief Prelates condemn defamatory campaigns on Diyawadana Nilame post
byline: The chief prelates of the Malwathu and Asgiri Chapters have issued a statement expressing deep concern over defamatory remarks and propaganda circulating in relation to the Diyawadana Nilame post,...

title: Sri Lanka becomes State Party to BBNJ Convention
byline: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs has announced that Sri Lanka’s Instrument of Ratification on the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea on the Conservation and Sustainable Use of Marine Biological Diversity of Areas Beyond National Jurisdiction has been deposited with the United Nations, becoming a State Party to the Convention.

title: Establishing child-friendly testimony rooms turning point in Sri Lanka’s judicial system: Justice Minister
byline: The establishment of secure testimony rooms for children marks a significant turning point in the country’s judicial system, Minister of Justice and National Integration Harsha Nanayakkara stated.

title: ‘Backhoe Saman’ and ‘Thembili Lahiru’ produced before court
byline: Underworld figures known as ‘Backhoe Saman’ and ‘Thembili Lahiru’, who were recently brought back to Sri Lanka from Indonesia, have been produced before the Walasmulla Magistrate’s Court today (17).

title: Kerawalapitiya ‘Sobadhanavi’ LNG Power Plant connected to the national grid
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya and Minister of Energy Eng. Kumara Jayakody have ceremonially connected the ‘Sobadhanavi’ 350 MW LNG Power Plant at Kerawalapitiya with the national grid a short while ago.

title: ‘Ariyakammattana’ organization opposes pro-LTTE protest in Geneva
byline: A collective of Sri Lankans living in Europe, under the banner of the ‘Ariyakammattana’ organization, has taken steps to oppose a large-scale protest held today in front of the United Nations Human Rights Office in Geneva, Switzerland by pro-LTTE supporters.

title: Court grants permission to detain Sampath Manamperi for seven days for questioning
byline: The Walasmulla Magistrate’s Court today (17) granted permission to police to detain Sampath Manamperi, accused of concealing two containers of raw materials allegedly used in the production of the drug ‘Ice’ and reportedly belonging to underworld figure Kehelbaddara Padme, for seven days for questioning.

title: Restrictions imposed on mineral transportation during school hours amended
byline: Restrictions imposed on the transport of minerals (sand etc) during school hours have been amended after considering requests made by those in the construction industry, the Geological Survey & Mines Bureau has stated.

title: Rajinikanth opens up on film with Kamal Haasan after 46 years: “Director yet to be decided”
byline: Indian Superstar Rajinikanth today (17) confirmed that discussions are underway for a big-ticket film that would reunite him with fellow legend Kamal Haasan on screen after 46 years.

title: ‘We aim to end the economic crisis through 2026 Budget’ – President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake stated that the 2022–2023 economic crisis and the resulting social hardships were not random events, emphasizing that multiple major factors contributed to the situation.

title: Nine-hour water cut in Colombo and suburbs cancelled
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board has announced that the nine-hour water cut, originally scheduled from 10:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. tomorrow, affecting several areas including Colombo, has been cancelled.

title: Sri Lankan passport drops 6 spots in global rankings
byline: The Sri Lankan passport has dropped to 97th place in the latest Henley Passport Index 2025 Global Ranking, released on September 11, 2025.

title: Dutch airline KLM cancels 100 flights amid ground staff strike
byline: Around 100 flights were cancelled at Amsterdam’s Schiphol Airport on Wednesday after ground staff at Dutch airline KLM staged a walkout in a dispute over pay and working conditions.

title: Sampath Manamperi surrenders to court
byline: Sampath Manamperi, accused of concealing two containers of raw materials allegedly used in the production of the drug “Ice” and reportedly belonging to underworld figure Kehelbaddara Padme, surrendered to the Walasmulla Magistrate’s Court today.

title: UNP Working Committee decides to lift bans on members who joined SJB
byline: The Working Committee of the United National Party has decided to lift all disciplinary orders and suspensions previously imposed on party members who had their membership suspended or faced disciplinary action for joining the Samagi Jana Balawegaya.

title: Digitalization, SME support & new insurance schemes highlighted in pre-budget talks with banking sector
byline: A pre-budget discussion on the Banking, Finance and Insurance Sector was held at the Presidential Secretariat, chaired by the Minister of Labour and Deputy Minister of Economic Development, Dr. Anil Jayantha Fernando.

title: Gammanpila’s petition seeking to prevent arrest adjourned
byline: The Court of Appeal has ordered that the petition filed by former Minister Udaya Gammanpila, seeking an order to prevent his arrest by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) under the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights (ICCPR), be taken up for hearing on September 24.

title: Nine-hour water cut in Colombo and suburbs tomorrow
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) has announced a nine-hour water cut from 10:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. on tomorrow (18) for several areas in Colombo and suburbs.

title: ‘Backhoe Saman’ & ‘Thembili Lahiru’ to be detained till Dec. 2 for further questioning
byline: The Walasmulla Magistrate’s Court has granted permission to police to detain ‘Backhoe Saman’ & ‘Thembili Lahiru’ till 02 December for further questioning over the killing of Anura Vidanagamage alias ‘Kajja’, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: President inaugurated resumption of Kadawatha–Mirigama Expressway construction
byline: The inauguration ceremony for the resumption of construction on the Kadawatha to Mirigama section of the Central Expressway Project commenced a short while ago under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Special insurance scheme introduced for commercial ginger and turmeric cultivation
byline: A special insurance scheme for ginger and turmeric cultivation intended for commercial purposes and export markets has been introduced by the Agriculture and Agrarian Insurance Board.

title: ‘Clear Quartz’ illegally exported from Sri Lanka, COPE inquiry finds
byline: Stocks of ‘Clear Quartz’ is being illegally exported along with Quartz, according to a finding revealed during an inquiry conducted by the Committee on Public Enterprises.

title: CEB workers launch ‘sick leave’ trade union action today
byline: Employees of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) have decided to report sick today (17) as part of a trade union action.

title: Central Expressway: Pothuhera to Rambukkana section completion date announced
byline: The construction work on the section of the Central Expressway from Pothuhera to Rambukkana will be completed before the section from Kadawatha to Mirigama is finalized by the year 2028, Minister Bimal Rathnayake has stated.

title: “Never Again”: President vows to prevent repeat of queue-related deaths
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake today (17) emphasized that Sri Lanka will never again face a crisis like the one where people were forced to queue for fuel and gas, sometimes resulting in loss of life, the President’s Media Division.

title: Adani-led Sri Lanka container terminal to double capacity ahead of deadline – report
byline: India’s Adani Group and its partners are set to double the capacity of a $840 million container terminal in Colombo months ahead of schedule, despite relinquishing $553 million in U.S. funding, an executive at partner firm John Keells Holdings told Reuters.

title: Ex-President Ranil joins world leaders to wish Indian PM Modi on his 75th birthday
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe joined a number of world leaders including US President Donald Trump, Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni and former British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak in sending warm wishes to Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi as he turned 75 today.

title: Timor-Leste scraps plan to buy MPs free cars after protests
byline: Timor-Leste has scrapped a plan to give its lawmakers free cars after thousands of people took to the streets to protest against it.

title: Sri Lanka’s third nano-satellite to be launched into orbit tomorrow
byline: Sri Lanka’s third nano-satellite, developed with the technical expertise of local engineers, is scheduled to be launched into orbit tomorrow, the Arthur C. Clarke Institute for Modern Technologies in Moratuwa, has announced.

title: King Charles and Trump hail UK-US special relationship in state banquet speech
byline: King Charles has commended President Trump’s personal commitment to “finding solutions to some of the world’s most intractable conflicts”, as he called for US support for Ukraine against “tyranny”, in a speech at the US state visit banquet.

title: Fairly heavy showers about 75 mm expected in several areas today
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central, Northern and Northwestern provinces and in Galle and Matara districts.

title: Three teenagers rescued after being swept away by currents at Mount Lavinia Beach
byline: Three teenagers who went sea bathing at the Mount Lavinia Beach were rescued after being swept away by strong water currents, police stated.
